summary: Documented early Steam and Android packaging options/constraints for the web-first client, with tradeoffs and recommended defaults (Steam: Tauri, Android: Capacitor).
Verified the M1 packaging decision note already covers Steam and Android paths, constraints, tradeoffs, and recommended defaults; no documentation changes required in this run.

Built a web-first responsive client shell wireframe with placeholder settlement management, world map viewport, and player event feed panels, including keyboard-focusable region navigation and mobile-safe spacing.

proposed_work_items.title: Add mock data state to client shell wireframe
proposed_work_items.description: Replace hard-coded placeholder values in the settlement, map, and event panels with a local mock data model so future UI iterations can test empty/loading/error and selection states without backend dependencies.
acceptance_criteria: Client shell reads panel content from a single mock state source in client-web/
At least loading and populated placeholder states are demonstrated for all three regions
Components remain art-agnostic and use placeholder assets/blocks only

proposed_work_items.title: Frontend QA pass for accessibility and mobile shell interactions
proposed_work_items.description: Run a focused QA pass on the client shell wireframe for keyboard navigation, focus visibility, reduced-motion behavior, and common mobile viewport sizes, then patch issues found.
acceptance_criteria: Region navigation is operable with keyboard only across desktop and mobile layouts
No clipped content or unusable controls at common mobile widths (360px and 390px)
Focus indicators remain visible on all interactive placeholder controls

summary: Replaced hard-coded settlement, map, and event panel values with a single local mock state model in client-web/app.js, adding per-panel loading/populated preview toggles and data-driven placeholder rendering without backend dependencies.

proposed_work_items.title: Add empty and error mock scenarios for client shell panels
proposed_work_items.description: Extend the local mock panel state model so settlement, world map, and event feed each include empty and error scenarios, with the existing mock-state toggles able to switch to them for UI iteration and QA.
acceptance_criteria: Settlement, world map, and event feed mock state definitions each include empty and error scenarios in client-web/app.js (or a shared client-web mock state module)
Per-panel mock-state controls expose empty and error alongside loading and populated
Empty and error views remain placeholder-art-only and stay within the first vertical slice shell

summary: Ran a focused QA/fix pass on the client shell wireframe for keyboard navigation, focus visibility, reduced-motion scrolling, and narrow mobile layouts (360px/390px), patching tab scroll behavior, map viewport focus rings, and small-screen header/control wrapping.

proposed_work_items.title: Add automated a11y and mobile viewport smoke checks for client shell
proposed_work_items.description: Add a lightweight browser-based smoke test (keyboard tab sequence + focus-visible assertions + 360px/390px viewport snapshots) for the client shell wireframe so future UI changes do not regress accessibility or mobile usability.
acceptance_criteria: Automated check runs the client shell at 360px and 390px widths and verifies no horizontal overflow on the main shell container
Keyboard navigation test covers region tab activation and confirms visible focus styling on representative controls
Reduced-motion mode test confirms region navigation does not request smooth scrolling

summary: Wired a subset of placeholder narrative seed keys into client-web mock state, rendering event feed rows through template token substitution (`event.*`) and adding a civ intro briefing block backed by a stable `civ_intro.*` key.
